name: Satvik Gupta
title: Software Developer

points: Trailblazed a Notification System as part of the Workspace Engineering team.
Engineered a secure REST API using Spring Boot and Slack Bolt SDK.
Expanded an existing Golang-based CLI to send terminal-triggered notifications.
Performed a spike on Temporal,a workflow execution system, utilizing its capabilities to efficiently schedule notifications
Explored softwares like AWS, Postman, Maven, and Puppet, turning insights into engaging articles.
Crafted 36 in-depth pieces, each a captivating dive into software, DSA, Cryptography, Shell Scripts, and beyond.
Delved hands-on into the software realm (AWS, Puppet, Salt, etc.), transforming experiences into tutorial treasures.
Crafted a standout Flutter app: capturing, storing, showcasing, and exporting ECG data from Arduino hardware.
Used SQLite for sleek local storage
Teamed up with a PhD researcher, infusing the app with Bluetooth for seamless communication with Arduino-based hardware.
Ignited a design shift on one app page, which was immediately adopted across other pages of the app
Added bilingual support to the app, making the app available in English/Hindi both. The architecture of this is such that you can add multiple languages later without any development effort.
Spearheaded a Flutter upgrade, cutting compile time by 40% and startup time by 30%,as well as boosting overall performance.

projects.name: DTU-DCE Fraternity Forum
points: Led a dynamic team of 3 in crafting the DTU-DCE Fraternity Forum app using Flutter, connected to a REST API.
Teamed up with the backend team to design a REST API for the app.
Enhanced user security with JWT authentication, ensuring tight access and safeguarding user data.
Provided admins an intuitive control hub within the app, making membership management a breeze.
Launched on Play Store and App Store, clocking 100+ downloads and snagging a stellar 5-star rating for a top-notch user experience.

achievements: Secured rank 3989 in TCS CodeVita Season 10, out of 100k + participants
Secured rank 1421 in Newton School's Grand Coding Contest 2022, out of roughly 12k participants
Secured All India Rank 5045 in JEE Mains 2020
Cleared KVPY SA (11th) First Round in 2018

pors.name: TEDxDTU
points: Led dynamic app development in Flutter, creating a seamless cross-platform experience with a responsive Next.js website.
Contributed significantly to the backend with Node.js, enhancing performance.
Orchestrated AWS EC2 setup for website hosting, implemented SSL certificates for secure communication, and later scaled performance on GCP Compute Engine.
Employed nginx as a reverse proxy for routing requests to the Node.js backend.

Achieved outstanding user engagement in 20 days, attracting 8k unique IP addresses and registering 1.5k users. Notably, 2/3rds of event tickets were sold on the site, highlighting its impactful success.
